util_pool_initialize
[Pool References]

Functions

void util_pool_initialize (util_pool_t *pool, void *mem, uint_t max, uint_t size)

Function Documentation

void util_pool_initialize ( util_pool_t *  pool,
void *  mem,
uint_t  max,
uint_t  size 
)

The util_pool_initialize initializes a pool used to handle unused objects. The resources needed for the pool (e.h. memory allocation) and the pool control structure have to be provided by the calling function.

NOTE: The size of an object requires at least the size of a void pointer.

Parameters:
pool Pointer to the user-supplied pool control block. Subsequent requests made to this pool require this pointer.
mem Specifies the address for the fixed-size memory area to be used for the pool. The memory allocation has to be done by the calling function before the call to this function.
max specifies the maximum number of objects that have to be managed.
size specifies the size in bytes of single a object.
